definition: to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)

sentences.english: Butterfly class at rest their wings folded up in back is.
sentences.chinese: 蝶類在休息時它們的翅是合攏起來立於背上。

sentences.english: Spiritless is the mouth which very difficult to close up.
sentences.chinese: 懦弱是一條很難合攏的口。

sentences.english: Said tubular or pipe-shaped material is wrapped onto an axis.
sentences.chinese: 上述筒狀或管狀材料合攏成層狀收卷在一個軸上。

sentences.english: The next morning, with the sound of firecrackers, the dock gate closure ceremony was held.
sentences.chinese: 次日上午，在炮竹聲中，塢門合攏儀式正式舉行。

sentences.english: Press the Foot Switch to close the head and perform the swage.
sentences.chinese: 踩腳踏板合攏扣壓機頭，完成扣壓。

sentences.english: The barrage closure works of Qingtongxia Key Water Control Project on Yellow River in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國青銅峽黃河水利樞紐工程攔河壩合攏截流。

sentences.english: After closure, final tensioning of stay 4 is accomplished .
sentences.chinese: 合攏以後，拉索4的最終張力即告完成。

sentences.english: The closure of steel sheet piles is the key to the construction of steel sheet pile cut-off walls.
sentences.chinese: 鋼板樁合攏是鋼板樁防滲牆施工的關鍵。

sentences.english: Ruihong Bridge Closure successful, Yugan to add new impetus to the development.
sentences.chinese: 瑞洪大橋合攏成功，給餘干增添了新的發展動力。

sentences.english: Begin to slide your hands up your spine, bringing palms together to touch in a prayer position.
sentences.chinese: 在脊椎部緩慢張開雙手，使手面合攏，做祈禱狀。

sentences.english: Thus, a formed net cover can cover and fold up to trap the mosquito like a clamp.
sentences.chinese: 這樣形成的網罩能罩住並如夾子般合攏夾死蚊子。

sentences.english: He snatched the pistol back, jealously; shut the knife, and returned it to its concealment.
sentences.chinese: 他猜忌地把手槍奪回去，合攏刀子，又把它藏回原處。

sentences.english: He closed his eyes and leaned back in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 他合攏雙眼，後靠在椅子裏。

sentences.english: Her fingers clutched the clothes, and gathered them over her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指緊揪住衣服，又把衣服合攏來遮住眼睛。

sentences.english: The clouds have reconvened by now, and it is raining hard.
sentences.chinese: 這時，烏雲重新合攏了，雨下得很大。

definition: to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
area above the lintel of a doorway
